pullRequest.title: Add support for private log subscriptions (Pub-Sub API)
pullRequest.bodyText:
PR description
• Created the two private subscription-related methods (priv_subscribe/priv_unsubscribe)
• Created a new type of subscription PrivateLogsSubscription
• Updated LogsSubscriptionService to observe new blocks and check for private logs (similar to what is done in the FilterManager).
• Updated WebSocketRequestHandler to deal with InvalidJsonRpcParameters exception
• Some plumbing work to get everything working together!
Fixed Issue(s)
fixes #762

nodes.bodyText: Should we also have a branch for an invalid params json rpc error?

I understand that we might not be able to reach the nirvana of not checking anything on disk for each block added event like we can with the mainnet side but could we at least take advantage of the fact that we already have the logs from the block added event and get the bare minimum from the privacy storage to filter a subset of them?

beforeCommit.message:
Observing blocks and checking for private logs

Signed-off-by: Lucas Saldanha <lucas.saldanha@consensys.net>

afterCommit.message:

Signed-off-by: Lucas Saldanha <lucas.saldanha@consensys.net>

nodes.bodyText:
could do an if/else or even
privacyQueries = privacyParameters.isEnabled() ? x : y;

Do you think you can come up with a better message? :-)
It looks like this is not used anywhere. So maybe just delete the line.

@@ -127,6 +127,7 @@
   PMT_FAILED_INTRINSIC_GAS_EXCEEDS_LIMIT(
       -50100,
       "Private Marker Transaction failed due to intrinsic gas exeeding the limit. Gas limit used from the Private Transaction."),
+  PRIVATE_SUBSCRIPTION_MULTI_TENANCY_ERROR(-50100, "foo."),

nodes.bodyText:
We do this in the PrivacyApiGroupJsonRpcMethods as well, but in the PrivJsonRpcMethods we do pass the privacy controller and the enclavePublicKeyProvider into the create() method.
This means that we have several instances of the controller and enclavePKP where we would only need one.
Can we fix that in a nice way?
I hope that nobody relies on the order ...
nit should it be jsonRpcRequestContext? Please check that in other tests in this file as well!
